speaker: EMCEE
message: My goodness it sounds like you were all busy! It's soooooo good to see everyone looking in such high spirits! I am happy your dates went so well!!

speaker: Wilhelmina
message: Better than well, EMCEE. I must say our prince is never bereft of surprises.

speaker: EMCEE
message: Oh I couldn't agree with you more Wilhelmina. He's a true fount of the unexpected.

speaker: Sienna
message: I am always so impressed that someone of his renown can be so easy to talk to.

speaker: EMCEE
message: He certainly has a gift for talking [i]at[/i] you. You're right about that.

speaker: Chessa
message: Speaking of, we have been talking your ear off EMCEE you must tell us about your time as well now. Please dish.

speaker: EMCEE
message: Well it won't compare to your time I'm sure, but I suppose I could tell you a bit about:
prompts: The wild and wonderful world of Condiments.
The fine art of fly hunting.
All the music he insisted on performing for me.
The finer details of horse coat upkeep.

responses.speaker: Chessa
responses.message: Excuse me… condiments? Oh you poor thing. I fear he must not be taking you very seriously. It's a shame he isn't sharing his more sentimental side with you, it's really a thing to behold.

responses.speaker: Chessa
responses.message: Sounds a bit brutish to me. I fear he might be trying to scare you away dear. It's a shame he isn't sharing his more sentimental side with you, it's [i]really[/i] a thing to behold.

responses.speaker: Chessa
responses.message: Ahhhhh see! That's the thing about him that drives me wild. You can [i]feel[/i] the weight of his words. I imagine his singing voice is like that of an Angel. [b]Ahhhh to think of him serenading me with "The Luna Sea Takes Us" as the moon shines brightly above us, be still my heart![/b]

responses.speaker: Chessa
responses.message: Oh ho ho you poor thing it sounds like he's preparing you for work in the stables instead of handling the kingdom's affairs. It's a shame he isn't sharing his more sentimental side with you, it's really a thing to behold.

speaker: Wilhelmina
message: Okkkaaaayyy Chessa calm yourself. Your enthusiasm is noted, but perhaps a bit much for the tea table.

speaker: EMCEE
message: Don't be too harsh on her Wilhemina. When the undertow of love pulls your head beneath the waves, it can be difficult to surface!

speaker: Wilhelmina
message: Annnnnd what of yourself, EMCEE? Have you found yourself swept away yet?

speaker: EMCEE
message: Ohhhh welll you know it's hard not to be when he talks about:
prompts: All the differences of Yellow and Honey Mustard.
The fact that apparently a Frog's tongue can move at 4 m/s.
How harmony isn't all that important when writing music.
All the ways that good coat maintenance helps with "Horse Chafing."

responses.speaker: Wilhelmina
responses.message: That's what does it for you, huh? To each their own, I suppose... Personally, I have been more taken by his knowledge in self-care and betterment, myself.

responses.speaker: Wilhelmina
responses.message: I... EMCEE this is a proper table, please keep your head out of the gutter. Personally, I have been more taken by his knowledge in self-care and betterment, myself.

responses.speaker: Wilhelmina
responses.message: Perhaps he simply enjoys avant-garde, modern music? Personally, I have been more taken by his knowledge in self-care and betterment, myself.

responses.speaker: Wilhelmina
responses.message: Now [i]there[/i] is a man who knows his stuff! It's not every prince who knows the best methods of utilizing Horse Oil for maintenance. [b]Crucially, it takes a diet of oats and apples to keep a healthy coat.[/b]

speaker: Sienna
message: I have been meaning to ask, Wilhemina. Does not it disturb you that Prince Gog owns and rides horses as a hobby?

speaker: Wilhelmina
message: I don't follow. What would be strange about that?

speaker: Sienna
message: Oh, uhm... how rude of me to cut you off EMCEE!

speaker: Sienna
message: Please, you were telling us about your date?

speaker: EMCEE
message: Right, right... so, according to what Gog was telling me:
prompts: Apparently condiment gourmands eat Mayonnaise "by the meter?"
That Fly Hunting is so popular because you can kill and eat your trophy in one motion.
That Timbre, Melody, and Rhythm are more of a suggestion than a rule.
Evidently, the whole lower half of a horse's leg can be thought of us as a foot!

responses.speaker: Sienna
responses.message: I'll admit, culinary endeavors have never been a strong point of mine. I've learned to value strength above all else! Crushing one's enemies! Conquest!! Destruction!!!

responses.speaker: Sienna
responses.message: Ruthless and efficient. That's how you [i]know[/i] he makes for an amazing ruler. [b]The only thing more attractive than a man who leads his people in battle is one who leaves triumphant![/b]

responses.speaker: Sienna
responses.message: Are they not at the heart of music composition, though? I'll admit, music has never been a strong point of mine. I've learned to value strength above all else! Crushing one's enemies! Conquest!! Destruction!!!

responses.speaker: Sienna
responses.message: Surely you jest! Why would you think I would care about such inane trivia? Horse feet are kingdoms apart from my passions!!

speaker: Sienna
message: [i]AHEM[/i] Sorry, I... lost myself there for a moment. Anyway, it's crazy to think we only have one date left, huh?

speaker: Chessa
message: I know… it's all gone by so fast it'll be kinda sad when it's all over.

speaker: Wilhelmina
message: Sad for you all, maybe.

speaker: Wilhelmina
message: I'm already planning the renovations necessary for my move-in.

speaker: EMCEE
message: I'll keep my fingers crossed for you, Wilhelmina. I would hate to see all the planning go to waste.

speaker: EMCEE
message: Well ladies, same time next week?
